edu.umw.cpsc.humantrafficking
Class Location

java.lang.Object
  edu.umw.cpsc.humantrafficking.Location

public class Location
extends java.lang.Object

Locations represent places where human trafficking victims can be present. They may be sources (where victims are abducted), destinations (where they are transported to serve as prostitutes), and/or transit locations (intermediate points on a route). A Location object keeps track of the location's victims, demand and export rate. It has its own function to schedule itself for the next step.

Field Summary
static double PROB_IMMIGRATION_SEARCH_SUCCESS
          The annual probability that an immigration search in this location will be successful this year, (possibly) resulting in existing victims being set free.

Field Detail

PROB_IMMIGRATION_SEARCH_SUCCESS

public static final double PROB_IMMIGRATION_SEARCH_SUCCESS
The annual probability that an immigration search in this location will be successful this year, (possibly) resulting in existing victims being set free.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

Location

public Location(java.lang.String name,
                double latN,
                double longE,
                int population,
                double genderRatio,
                double appAgeRatio)
Constructor to instantiate new Location objects.

Parameters:
name - the name of the location (may be multiple words; should be globally unique across all Location objects).
latN - the location's latitude in degrees (positive numbers indicate "North", negative "South").
longE - the location's longitude in degrees (positive numbers indicate "East", negative "West").
population - the number of non-victims, in individuals.
genderRatio - a number from 0 to 1, indicating the fraction of females in the population.
appAgeRatio - a number from 0 to 1, indicating the fraction of humans of "prostitution age" (12-30).
Method Detail

addVictimFromLocalPopulation

public void addVictimFromLocalPopulation(Victim v)
Add a victim to this Location's collection of victims and removes them from the current population. This function is used when instantiating new victims.

Parameters:
v - a Victim.

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Return the name of this location (possibly containing spaces).

addVictimFromExternalLocation

public void addVictimFromExternalLocation(Victim v)
Add a victim to this Location, and changes that victim's location. This is called when victims are moved from one location to another.

Parameters:
v - a Victim.

addEscapee

public void addEscapee(Victim v)
Add a victim as an "escapee" in this location.

Remove a victim from this location's list of "escapees".

getVics

public java.util.ArrayList<Victim> getVics()
Return the current victims at this location (i.e., not including escapees.)

removeVictim

public void removeVictim(Victim v)
Removes a victim from this location. The victim is not added back to the local population.

Parameters:
v - a Victim to be removed. If the Victim is not currently in this Location, this method has no effect.

getLong

public double getLong()
Return the longitude of this location, in degrees (positive numbers mean "East", negative "West".)

Returns the number of Victims currently at this location (and in captivity.)

getNumEscapees

public int getNumEscapees()
Returns the number of Victims currently having escaped from this location (and vulnerable to being reacquired from here.)

extractRandomVic

public Victim extractRandomVic()
Take a random Victim at this location, remove her from this location, and return her to the caller. The Victim's location will be (temporarily) set to null as a result.

extractRandomEscapee

public Victim extractRandomEscapee()
Take a random Escapee at this location, remove her from this location, and return her to the caller. The Victim's location will be (temporarily) set to null as a result.

getPop

public int getPop()
Returns the number of non-Victims, but "eligible" potential Victims, currently at this location (not in captivity.)

performImmigrationSearch

public void performImmigrationSearch()
Determine whether an immigration search in this location is successful this year, and if so, set a random number of its victims free.

getDemand

public double getDemand()
TODO Generates demand based off of factors in the location. Returns a number in the range [0.9,1.1] indicating a multiplicative factor for victims on this route.

Returns:
a multiplicative factor for victims on this route. Numbers greater than 1 indicate a higher-than-usual demand on the destination side, while numbers less than 1 indicate lower-than-usual demand.

getEligibleVics

public int getEligibleVics()
Computes eligible victims based off of the properties at the current location.

Returns:
the number of eligible victims at this location.
